content.title: Dr. MはKLの周りを駆け抜けて、「反アイザドラリーの余波を見る」 -  Malaysiakini
content.desc: Malaysiakini Prime Minister Dr Mahathir Mohamad drove himself around Kuala Lumpur this evening, after the rally against the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination (Icerd) ended. According to blogger Firdaus Abdullah, Mahathir was driving to "see for himself the situation in the capital after the anti-Icerd rally". Firdaus had tweeted a video of Mahathir driving a Proton, the interior of which matches the new Proton X70 SUV. The sirens from his police escorts can be heard. The view outside the window places Mahathir near the golden triangle, driving along Jalan ...

content.title: マハティール、UmnoカエルをPPBMに参加させる -  Malaysia Today
content.desc: (MMO) – Despite initially denouncing party defectors, Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad has seemingly softened his stance towards “political frogs”, now saying that it is their democratic right to do so. “We are a democratic government, we believe in democracy, and democracy allows frogs to jump,” a rather impish Dr Mahathir said, when asked when Pakatan Harapan (PH) would propose a law to prevent politicians who switch camps. In October, Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (PPBM) led by Dr Mahathir, stirred controversy by seeking to accommodate Umno defectors, a move largely seen as a stra...

content.title: Dr M：明日のSuhakamイベントには出席できない -  Malaysia Today
content.desc: “I decided that we will not accept ICERD. Suhakam wants to accept ICERD. So, how can I go?” (FMT) – Prime Minister Dr Mahathir Mohamad has questioned how he will be able to attend a pro-human rights celebration tomorrow now that the government has taken an about-turn in ratifying ICERD. “I decided that we will not accept ICERD (the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination). “Suhakam (the Malaysian Human Rights Commission) wants to accept ICERD. “So, how can I go?” asked the Pakatan Harapan (PH) chairman after chairing the PH Presidential Council meet...

content.title: マレーシア：政府の弱さに対する懸念の中、マレーシア首脳会議 - アルジャジーラ英語
content.desc: Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia - Tens of thousands of ethnic Malays have taken to the streets of Malaysia's capital to "celebrate" a government decision not to ratify a key UN anti-discrimination treaty, amid growing concerns the seven-month administration of Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad is losing reform momentum. Malaysia is one of only 14 countries in the world that have yet to sign the International Convention on the Elimination of all forms of Racial Discrimination (ICERD). The treaty what constitutes racial discrimination and sets forth a series of principles and guidelines by which states ...

content.title: 人権の日の祝典の延期は、アンビガを打ちのめす - スターオンライン
content.desc: PETALING JAYA: Activist Datuk Ambiga Sreenevasan (pic) has criticised authorities over the postponement of the Human Rights Day celebration by one day. It will now be held on Sunday (Dec 9). In a series of tweets on Friday (Dec 7), the former Bersih chairman and Bar Council president described the postponement of the celebration by the Human Rights Commission of Malaysia (Suhakam) as akin to "giving in to bullies". "Asking Suhakam to cancel an event that celebrates International Human Rights Day which many have done for years and years. Wow! That's a first. So now we celebrate by cancelling...

content.title: マレーシア・トゥデー、反ICERD集会に出席して100万人に感謝
content.desc: (MMO) – Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad today appeared unconcern with the mammoth anti-ICERD ‘thanksgiving’ rally, sarcastically thanking the one million people who turned up at the event. “We know that the gathering today was attended by one million people, and I thank them because they gathered for thanksgiving. One million people. Thank you,” he told a press conference here after the Pakatan Harapan (PH) Presidential Council meeting. He also gave himself a pat on the back, over his recent decision to not ratify the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial...

content.title: Billion Dollar WhaleのBM版が発売 - スターオンライン
content.desc: PETALING JAYA: The Malay edition of the Billion Dollar Whale book has been launched. Entrepreneur Development Minister Datuk Seri Mohd Redzuan Md Yusof, who launched the book here on Saturday (Dec 8), said that the book had revealed much of his suspicion. "It is an excellent piece of writing, which I hope will reach out to the people. It describes what I have found out before," he said. Redzuan said that he was in contact with the Department of Justice in the United States in 2016, and enquired whether there was any truth about alleged stolen funds from the 1Malaysia Development Bhd (1MDB)....

content.title: パカタンは、ランタオとキャメロンハイランドに最初に席を争うパーティーに - スターオンライン
content.desc: In preparation for the anticipated by-elections in Cameron Highlands and Rantau, Pakatan Harapan is ready to field candidates of the same parties which contested those seats in the 14th General Election. Pakatan chairman Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad said the coalition agreed to this at the Pakatan Harapan's presidential council meeting on Saturday (Dec 8). He also said it is up to to the parties to select their candidates when it is called and they will contest under the Pakatan Harapan logo and not PKR's. He told reporters after the Pakatan Harapan presidential council meeting on Saturday.

content.title: Suhakamは、人権の日のお祝いを日曜日（12月9日）に移します。
content.desc: KUALA LUMPUR: The Human Rights Commission of Malaysia (Suhakam) will postpone its Human Rights Day celebration to Sunday (Dec 9). It tweeted on Friday: "Suhakam's #HumanRightsDay celebration will now be held on 9 December 2018. Join us in #StandingUpForHumanRights". Its chief commissioner Tan Sri Razali Ismail said that the decision to postpone the celebrations was made after they were advised to do so by Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad. Razali said that police had also informed Dr Mahathir of the risk to national security. "The Prime Minister said that he would not be attending the ...

content.title: 元シンガポールの外交官、サイファディンの紛争処理の撤廃計画を掘り起こす - マレーシア・トゥデイ
content.desc: (FMT) – Former Singapore diplomat Bilahari Kausikan today took a dig at Foreign Minister Saifuddin Abdullah over his proposal to lower tensions between the neighbours. Accusing Malaysia of creating the problem over territorial intrusions, he mockingly said Putrajaya now wanted Singapore to share responsibility for the problem. He said in a Facebook post: “You have to admire the Malaysian foreign minister’s ctuzpah: You create a problem, when we respond to defend our interests, you say that the solution to the problem you created in the first place is for us to cease defending our interests ...

content.title: マレーシアの逃亡者であるJho Low、4人の新人が1MDBの新料金で殴打 - ロイター
content.desc: Malaysian police filed fresh criminal charges and issued arrest warrants for fugitive financier Low Taek Jho and four others wanted in connection with a multi-billion-dollar scandal at state fund 1MDB, officials said on Wednesday. Low, popularly known as Jho Low, has been identified by Malaysian and U.S. investigators as a central figure in the alleged theft of about $4.5 billion from 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB). Low, whose whereabouts is not known, has denied any wrongdoing through a spokesman. Last month, U.S. prosecutors charged Low and two former Goldman Sachs bankers with consp...

content.title: Dr M：「カエル」が飛ぶことを可能にする民主主義 -  The Star Online
content.desc: PETALING JAYA: The Government will not be pushing for any anti-hopping law that prevents elected representatives from deserting their parties. "We are a democratic government. Democracy allows frogs to jump," Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad told reporters after the Pakatan Harapan presidential council meeting. The Pakatan chairman was asked whether he will push for an anti party-hopping law during his tenure as Prime Minister, especially when there are elected MPs hopping to his Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (Bersatu). In October, former International Trade and Industry Minister Dat...

content.title: 両集会で期待される強力なシグナル - マレーシア・トゥデー
content.desc: In a sense, the anti-Icerd rally is a personal challenge to his leadership as the top Malay and Muslim leader. Joceline Tan, The Star THE line in the sand will be more clearly drawn than ever after tomorrow, with the predominantly Malay political opposition on one side and a more mixed ruling coalition on the other. The anti-Icerd rally engineered by PAS and Umno has all the signs of being the biggest Malay-Muslim street protest the country has ever seen in recent times. Parallels are being drawn to the mammoth Islamist rally in Jakarta last weekend that turned the biggest intersection in t...

content.title: 博士M：間違った道を取ったときにパカタンだけがUターンする - マレーシア・トゥデイ
content.desc: “We are not perfect people. Although most of us are angels, but even angels sometimes make mistakes. So when angels makes mistakes, they turn around.” (MMO) – Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad today made a cheeky comeback to critics who labelled his administration as a “U-turn government”. In a press conference here using veiled replies, the Langkawi MP said that turnarounds under his governance were only done if necessary, adding that the Pakatan Harapan (PH) Cabinet was not perfect though it has been trying to correct many things. “Sometimes when we go the wrong way, we turn around, ...

content.title: Dr Mは、日曜日にSuhakamのHuman Rights Dayのお祝いに出席しません -  The Star Online
content.desc: PETALING JAYA: Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad will not be attending the Human Rights Commission of Malaysia (Suhakam)’s Human Rights Day celebration on Sunday (Dec 9). Dr Mahathir explained that this was because the government had already decided against ratifying the International Convention on the Elimination of Racial Discrimination (Icerd), which was in contrary towards Suhakam’s stand on the contentious issue. “I decided that we will not accept Icerd. Suhakam wants to accept Icerd. So, how can I go,” he said. Dr Mahathir said this after chairing Pakatan Harapan’s presidential c...

content.title: パカタンの指導者、ラリージレンマに直面 - マレーシア本日
content.desc: (The Star) – Pakatan Hara­p­an leaders seem to be in a quandary as to whether disciplinary action should be taken against party members who attend tomorrow’s anti-Icerd (International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination) rally organised by Umno and PAS. So far, no Pakatan party has issued a ban on members attending the anti-Icerd rally. PKR vice-president Zuraida Kamaruddin, however, said action should be taken against PKR members who attend the anti-Icerd rally as the party itself had said it is against the rally. Parti Amanah Nasional (Amanah) president Moh...

content.title: Tun M：シンガポールと国境を越えて交渉中 - スターオンライン
content.desc: PETALING JAYA: Malaysia has yet to respond to Singapore's rejection to stop assets from being deployed to a disputed area in the Johor Straits, in light of the disagreements over the Declaration of Port Limits for Johor Baru Port. Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad said the Government could not give a final answer until negotiations are over. "The important thing is Singapore agreed to negotiations, so until we finish negotiations, we cannot give a final answer," he said. "We need to settle these disputes based on legal provisions and our rights," said the Pakatan Harapan Chairman after...

content.title: Dr M to Jho Low：心配しないで、マレーシアの裁判官は公正です -  The Star Online
content.desc: PETALING JAYA: Fugitive businessman Jho Low need not fear of not having a fair trial in Malaysia, as Malaysian judges are quite fair, says Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad. "He must know he is guilty, so when he is guilty, he will feel that the judgement is not fair," said the Prime Minister. He said everyone had to appear in court and not keep on dismissing the charges or getting judges that may serve an individual's personal interests. "We have to accept the institution of the judiciary is not being interfered by this Government," he said after a meeting with Pakatan Harapan leaders. It was repor...

content.title: PM：M'siaは先進国の仲間に加わる前に腐敗に立ち向かわなければならない
content.desc: Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad on Friday said corruption must be taken seriously if Malaysia wants to join the ranks of developed countries. Describing corruption as an "awful thing", Dr Mahathir said it could cause irreparable damage to society and the nation. He said this in his address at the Sheikh Tamim Hamad Al-Thani International Anti-Corruption Excellence Award ceremony in Putrajaya. Read more at: https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2018/12/07/pm-malaysia-much-tackle-corruption-head-on-before-joining-ranks-of-developed-countries/
